answerText: Name this novel that contrasts the aristocratic background of Charles Egremont with the working class, Chartist background of the title character, whom Egremont eventually marries.[10] Sibyl was written by this author of Vivian Grey and Coningsby, a noted British politician.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | Michigan A + George Mason | 18 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: One bar in this novel is The Temple, which is frequented by Dandy Mick and a boy who got his nickname after fending for himself from infanthood until he was five years old, Devilsdust.  For 10 points each: [10] Name this novel that contrasts the aristocratic background of Charles Egremont with the working class, Chartist background of the title character, whom Egremont eventually marries.
